markdown.markdown:
**Movable Antenna (MA) for Anti-interference** [*(Just start)*]{.cvdate} - ***Main tools***: `matlab`. - A heuristic investigation into Anti-jamming through stochastic antenna movement, conducted under the supervision of [Prof. Weidong Mei](https://scholar.google.com.sg/citations?user=JtHltIoAAAAJ&hl=en-EN). **Computer Vision (CV) for Quadrotor Aircraft** [*(Just start)*]{.cvdate} - ***Main tools***: `matlab`, `C/C++`, `python`, `verilog`. - A group project (6 people) for bare-metal programming for an automatic quadrotor aircraft for objection detection, robotic arm manipulation, and closed-loop flight control. **[RV32I CPU Core for Education](https://github.com/Marcobisky/my-riscv)**
[*(Jan 2025 --- Present)*]{.cvdate} ::: {.column-margin} ![GPIO simulation in `Digital`](images/my-riscv.png){.only-html} ::: - ***Main tools***: `verilog`, `VHDL`, `Digital`, Kicad, iCESuger FPGA. - Simulate an entire RISC-V 32 bit CPU in verilog and `Digital` Software. - Support basic peripherals such as GPIOs, IIC, UART, VGA, etc. - Simple boot ROM in assembly, minimal interrupt service for running a Linux kernel. - Complete PCB design in Kicad (Not finished). **[AME Source Coding](https://github.com/Marcobisky/ame-entropy-source-coding)** [(*Oct 2024 --- Nov 2024*)]{.cvdate} ::: {.column-margin} ![Proposed AME coding scheme](images/ame.png) ::: - ***Main tools***: `python`, `matlab`. - Final project of **Information Theory** Course. - Developed a method (Second-order Markov Adapative Approximation, AME) to perform source coding for *the Game of Thrones*. The performance of Huffman and Fano coding was also evaluated. **[CNN for Mbed](https://github.com/Marcobisky/CNN-for-mbed)** [(*Feb 2024 --- May 2024*)]{.cvdate} ::: {.column-margin} ![Proposed CNN in L432KC MCU](images/cnn.png) ::: - ***Main tools***: `python`, `C++`. - Integrated a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) into an MCU for smart fall detection for the elderly. - Realized functions include smart fall detection, body temperature monitoring and real-time data visualization. **A Study of Generalized Fields and Extension to Higher Dimensions[^physics]** [(*Oct 2023 --- Feb 2024*)]{.cvdate} [^physics]: I submitted [this paper](physics-paper.pdf) to the [American Journal of Physics](https://pubs.aip.org/aapt/ajp), but it was declined for publication. ::: {.column-margin} ![Fields in high dimension can be reduced](images/generalized-fields.png) ::: - A theoretical study of generalized natural fields and behaviours in higher dimensions. - Largely motivated by my tutor Mr. [Yidong Liu](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Amwv33EAAAAJ&hl=en) and my friends and complete by myself. **Human Voice Recognition Smart Car** [(*Sept 2023 --- Dec 2023*)]{.cvdate} ::: {.column-margin} ![Voice-controlled car](images/smart-car.jpg) ::: - ***Main tools***: `C++`, STM32F103C8T6 MCU, etc. - Led a team of a group of 4 people. - Built a car with recognition of pre-defined English words to control the movements of a small car. Basic operations include moving forwards and backwards, turning or sliding left and right, etc. **Auto Door Opener for Dormitory** [(*Sept 2023 --- Oct 2023*)]{.cvdate} ::: {.column-margin} ![Door opener tested on breadboard](images/smart-door-opener.JPG) ::: - ***Main tools***: `C++`, Nucleo L432KC MCU, Mbed library, OLED screen, etc. - This was the final project of the Microelectronic System course. - Realized opening our dormitory door by simply entering password from a keyboard outside the room (instead of using physical keys). Basic functions include setting up password manually, automatically lock if wrong password is entered over 5 times, display messages on an OLED screen, etc. **"XinTong Cup" Electronic Design Competition: Electronic Keyboard Music Player** [(*Sept 2022 --- Oct 2022*)]{.cvdate} - ***Main tools***: `Keil C51`, STC89C52RC MCU, etc. - Led a small team of a group of 3 people. - Successfully built a simplified keyboard music player with 8 keys using an 8-bit MCU by ST company and Keil C51 language for register-based development. - Functionality of the keyboard music player consists: Single note playing, chord playing, recording ability, replay and rewind capability, etc. ## ACADEMIC RECORD +--------+-------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | Year | Subject[^bold] | Score | +========+=============================================================+========================================+ | Year 1 | **Calculus I/II**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **91/92**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Linear Algebra**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **84**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **C Programming**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **95**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Physics I**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **88**
[\newline]{.print-only} | +--------+-------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | Year 2 | **Physics II**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **96**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Signal and Systems**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **91**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Probability and Statistics**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **92**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | Microelectronic Systems
[\newline]{.print-only} | 92
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Embedded Processors**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **95**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Circuit Analysis and Design**
[\newline]{.print-only}| **95**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | Computer Network
[\newline]{.print-only} | 94
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Academic English**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **89**
[\newline]{.print-only} | +--------+-------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ | Year 3 | Information Theory
[\newline]{.print-only} | 91
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | Principles of Communication
[\newline]{.print-only} | 95
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Digital Circuit Design**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **86**
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | Machine Learning
[\newline]{.print-only} | 86
[\newline]{.print-only} | | | **Stochastic Signal Analysis**
[\newline]{.print-only} | **82**
| +--------+-------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------+ : Detailed scores of core courses (**GPA: 3.88**) [^bold]: I'm relatively confident in my understanding of the Boldface subjects. ## RELEVANT SKILLS - **IT Skills**: Latex, (Quarto) Markdown, Typst, Manim[^manim], Github[^github], Microsoft Office. - **Computer Programming**: `C/C++`, `Matlab`, `Python`. - **Embedded System Programming**: `RISCV assembly`, STM89C5x (Standard lib), Keil C51. - **Math**: Self learned ([Abstract Algebra (Harvard E-222)](http://wayback.archive-it.org/3671/20150528171650/https://www.extension.harvard.edu/open-learning-initiative/abstract-algebra)), [Point-set Topology](https://www.math.toronto.edu/ivan/mat327/?resources), [Measure Theory](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xZ69KEg7ccU&list=PLBh2i93oe2qvMVqAzsX1Kuv6-4fjazZ8j), [Complex Analysis (MIT 18.04)](https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/18-04-complex-variables-with-applications-spring-2018/), [Functional Analysis](https://books.google.com.sg/books/about/Functional_Analysis.html?id=LzgqBAAAQBAJ&source=kp_cover&redir_esc=y), Elementary [Differential Geometry](https://www.amazon.sg/Visual-Introduction-Differential-Calculus-Manifolds/dp/3319969919), [Smooth Manifolds](https://www.amazon.sg/dp/1441973990?ref_=mr_referred_us_sg_sg) (*still learning*). I didn't go too deep in each of these subjects, but I understand their motivation and basic ideas behind them so that I will use fewer time learning these. - **Team Work**: Zoom meeting, Notion team, Microsoft team. - **Language**: No problem in understanding English lectures, native Chinese. [^manim]: See [here](https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1AterevErt/?spm_id_from=333.1387.homepage.video_card.click&vd_source=42579e22289b6144ba0b2bdcf99834e3) where I use `manim` to explain the relation between adjoint and dual operator. [^github]: My [repository](https://github.com/Marcobisky). ## OTHERS - **Classical Music Enthusiast🎻**: Violin player in UESTC symphony orchestra, votary of legendary composer Gustav Mahler and Johann Sebastian Bach. - **Badminton Lover🏸**: Sports always refreshes me at any time. - **Learn Everything🔍**: I'm open to think and learn *everything* exist or non-exist on earth. - **Volunteer Work🤝**: Love helping others, over 15 hours of volunteering.
